caption: A NY and Bronx treasure.
Always the Best Food and Great times. Roberto is an artist!
Our waiter was very nervous and uncomfortable. Made our experience uncomfortable as well
The food and service is good as any old Italian restaurant
Exceptional food,  excellent wine list, great service.  Their pasta is cooked to perfection and their burrata appetizer is the best I have ever had.
Fantastic food and attentive service! The fresh truffle pasta in the fall is pricey but totally worth it.
Very tasty but pricey

Very good italian food overall. I had the Veal Osso Buco (if that's how you spell it) and it was very nice with a delicious sauce and marrow. Service was a little slow but very friendly and attentive. The Manhattan cocktail was great (especially with the Rye). My brother had the pasta and truffle special which was devine. The only reason I don't rate this 5 stars is the high price of the cocktails ($15 each) and the lessened menu due to coronavirus. Overall Roberto's should be on your list of restaurants to visit in the Arthur ave section of the Bronx due to its amazing traditional italian faire.
My favorite restaurant,  food is outstanding and the staff is amazing

Great atmosphere.  Service was excellent. The staff was attentive and made sure we were taken care of. The pasta dish was fresh with a good portion size enough for two to share. The red snapper special had a savory sauce with olives and clams. Yummy!
real Italian
I have been going here for a while, I love the food and service, everything is pretty good quality and flavorful. I'm never disappointed. They are fairly decently priced

I visit this lovely place often! This is my favorite spot to have a bite.  I go there frequently. The food is of high quality, the staff is polite and the rates are decent. I enjoy eating in this place to have a rich dinner.
A beautiful Italian eatery
Would absolutely recommend trying this spot. Excellent ambience, delightful dishes, great customer service. I recommend this place.
This place never fails to impress. They serve good food for fair pricing, there are no long waits even when they are packed.
The food was salty and cold.  The service was very slow.   Our server had no clue about wines. I’m very disappointed.   I will never go back.

This place has changed a lot.  Nothing is the same anymore.   I was at Robertos last Thursday.  The food was disgusting.  The service horrible.   It took forever for our food to come.  I will definitely never come back.
Tried this spot in the past with a friend and I am addicted since then. I liked the fantastic character and yummy food and beverages. I recommend this place.
pasta with black truffles.....divine
The food is always fresh and delightful, workers hands out good service. I really like how neat it is and mood. Highly recommended.
Terrible experience!  Never again!

Been going here since I was a little kid even at their older location. I try to make it here at least once a year and have celebrated many milestones. The service here is excellent and the food is exceptional. It's an authentic experience with food inspired by Roberto's home town in Italy. I like how the dishes aren't the typical dishes everyone is familiar with. Instead of typical names, the menu lists the type of pasta with it's listed ingredients cooked in a certain way.
Nice atmosphere

Im not usually a reviewer but this place I had to post a review. OVERPRICED and POOR quality food. Went there for Valentine’s Day! Had made a reservation 2 weeks earlier and yet went we arrived there were ushered downstairs to the claustrophobic BASEMENT. So i figured ok maybe food will make up for it. Boy was I wrong. Ordered veal special ($30) the veal was old and tough. My wife had the pasta special with truffles ($45!). Overcooked  and dry sauce and  black truffle sliced on top had no aroma at all! Appetizer cold cut ($23) With 6 slices of salami some cheese and 1 slice of prosciutto that me and my wife had to split! We left place feeling like we had just been ripped off! Only good thing waiter was courteous.
The set is elegant and the staff courteous.
I had a great time. Calamari salad was delicious. Veal special and had as dessert the Tiramisu was one of the best I have had.  I would like to go back

If you're planning a trip to the Bronx Zoo or New York's Botanical Garden for lunch or dinner in Roberto, just seven is a minute away. There's always parking nearby. It's a wonderful safe area just two blocks from Arthur Avenue, and that's all it offers.  Great food, drinks are plenty, and service is very good. It is actually even worth the trip, even if you are not going to the nearest attractions. I highly recommend it.  We all have brpught there, love it, love it. In a very good way, it's an old-fashioned Italian restaurant.
Definitely a place worth visiting, the food is great and fresh, the prices are convenient and it is always well organized there. Great work.
Just like Mama made!

Really liked this place.  Was there for lunch and had an excellent skirt steak dish.  It also helps that there is a municipal parking lot nearby.  Will definitely go again and looking forward to trying more of the menu.
Delicious food, great friendly service.
Great service! Food was cooked to perfection! Will come back again!
Good service very good food 👍
Good food and good cervice
Excellent food.

I LOVE it here! We went last night with a large group for my cousins birthday, we were seated in the main dining room with great ambiance, our server Lonny was a gem and his team along with the hostess were so wonderful to us! Our meals were so delicious perfect size portions, the way they sing happy birthday is honestly the best in any restaurant I’ve ever been to 😊 Dessert was also great. I recommend making a reservation. I will definitely be back! Thanks for such a great experience in Little Italy 🇮🇹
Great atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff. Food was presented beautifully and tasted great. Bathroom was very clean! Will definitely visit again.
Nice cozy dining with great food and service.
Food has No  taste, hard to park, poor dollar value
Wonderful food, great service. A bit too dark to read the menu.

(Translated by Google) Nice Italian restaurant in the heart of the little italy queens. A hushed and upscale atmosphere that contrasts with the neighborhood. The service is very attentive. The fresh pasta is good, however the mozza did not reach my expectations. Tomato served with no taste and hard. I would have preferred another seasonal vegetable. A bit expensive for the value for money.  (Original) Resto italien sympa au cœur de la petite italy du queens. Une ambiance feutrée et haut de gamme qui tranche un peu avec le quartier. Le service est très attentionné. Les pâtes fraiches sont bonnes, cependant la mozza n'a pas atteint mes espérances. La tomate servie avec sans goût et dur. J'aurais préféré un autre légume de saison. Un peu cher pour le rapport qualité prix.
(Translated by Google) Very rich everything, pay very comfortable 🍷🤗🥩  (Original) Muy rico todo,pague muy agusto 🍷🤗🥩
Tell them it's your birthday

The votes are in, hands down my favorite Italian restaurant.  Roberto's is what all Italian restaurants should strive to be,  innovative, different, cutting edge.  I have been going to Roberto's for 20 years and I have never ordered off the menu, the specials are just that, special! The pastas are homemade, from the agnelotti to the fusilli they are melt in your mouth good.  The entrees are fantastic, the osso buco, spicy chicken, rabbit or branzino are terrific.  Great service and reasonable prices- go to Roberto's you'd think you died and went to Italy.
Atmosphere and service were superb, food was delicious!! Only hassle is the parking but I guess that is to be expected.  100% reccomend
Even though I haven't been here since he moved from Crescent, I love this man.  He treats and feeds you like long lost family. I miss Roberto's!

Had the veal shank special. Had to be 24 ounces or more. Delicious. Polenta was good. Spaghetti was not as good as I had hoped, especially for homemade. Service was good. Prices fair. Will definitely return. Great place for dinner after the Bronx Zoo or a visit to Fordham.
Great atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff. Food was presented beautifully and tasted great. Bathroom was very clean! Will definitely visit again.
good fresh italian food. saluti🥂
Excellent restsurant, fabulous food - different from the usual Arthur Avenue restaurants. I was treated very well by all the staff. Highly recommend Roberto's
(Translated by Google) I love the food and service it gives  (Original) Me encanta  la comida y servicio que da
Wonderful place, good food and very nice and professional staff. And very cute one's. too.
Lovely date night with the love of my life. Small, intimate and very romantic. Oh yes, and the food is always top notch!❤
Good atmosphere,  decent food and pricing
Been going to Roberto's for years and still great. Now I am gluten free I had gluten free pasta in the tin foil and was fantastic.
I constantly come by purchasing some food in this spot. I love the efficient service and well prepared food. Keep it up.
Great service. Really salty seafood.
This place always delivers. They serve excellent food for reasonable prices, there are no long waits even when they are loaded.
Awesome place,romantic ambience,delicious and fresh food,great menu,large variety of wines,awesome staff!Thank you so much.
Superb food, atmosphere and as walk in couple they were very accommodating. Highly recommend.
Roberto's is a treasure. Legitimated unfussy Italian food of fine ingerdients served by one of the best wait teams in Gotham.
Authentic, old school Italian. Often a long wait.
Real italian ,not italian american,Excellent all around
Excellent service, nice wine list and cocktails. The main dishes and pasta were better than appetizers and desserts
Best Italian food in Bronx. Highly recommended!!!
Outstanding.
I very much like their dishes and service, fantastic location very close to my home. The employees are always super nice. Would recommend to others.
My favorite restaurant in the Bronx.
The standard for Italian restaurants

Restaurants a little pricey for Arthur, but the food is excellent. Went here with my family for parents weekend. Especially love the bread with the tomatoes baked in. Can’t go wrong with anything on the menu, the service is great, and the atmosphere is phenomenal.
Just ate there, the food was great and the service was excellent.
Great atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff. Food was presented beautifully and tasted great. Bathroom was very clean! Will definitely visit again.

The food was absolutely phenomenal. You can really taste how fresh the ingredients are. The flavors compliment each other so well. They have a great selection of wind and drinks. The service was amazing as well, top notch. The atmosphere is very intimate with the dimmed lighting. We enjoyed ourselves very much, will definitely be returning.
Staff was on point
Our pasta dishes were delicious. Flavors perfectly balanced and everything complimented. Dessert was wonderful also. Highly recommended. Many vegetarian pastas on the menu and specials board.
Good food.

Very disappointed. Went to celebrate my birthday with party of 10 friends. All were disappointed with their entrees including myself. The appetizers were probably the highlight and they were nothing to rave about. Service is excellent, wish the food was too!

Real deal Northern Italian food. If you want tons of red sauce over tons and tons of cheese, not your place. Nothing wrong with tons of sauce and cheese. Its just not authentic real deal Italian. Roberto's is legit Italian food, not Italian-American
Very friendly,  authentic,  excellent place to eat and drink
One of my Favorites...always delivers quality food.
This place is GREAT. The food is VERY good. The staff and service is awsome. The setting is intimate and nice. The pricing is good with many operations for food and drinks. Will be back for sure.
Awesome place. One of the best in AA area!
Great creative food
Excellent meal as always!  Always order the special appetizer in the foil! Never fails to be amazing!
Best Italian cuisine in NYC
Fantastic high quality Italian food. A true Arthur Ave gem. Owner has two other popular eateries in the neighborhood as well.
Excellent
Old school Italian in the Bronx. Has a loyal following - I just don’t get it
It's as advertised, delicious food, kind and friendly staff. I shall return, over and over and over
Food was great
Great place for Italian food that is not typical Italian American.
Fresh pasta and great wine served traditionally.
Great food and friendly service.

This is not what I would call a family friendly restaurant...in fact it's not friendly to anyone. No side orders, no small salads, no anything that you may want.  I have never been told NO so much in any restaurant I have been in.  As a matter of fact the waiter told us he could get fired for switching one of our dishes from potatoes to mozzarella cheese..definitely not a fun time
It was a very extraordinary experience, service excellent  food fisrt class
Lovely meal downstairs is cozy, great wine list. Impeccable service.
Loved this restaurant and the food/service.
Large, great menu, informed, expert servers. All matched by a superlative kitchen.
Incredible Food.
Excellent

Incredible experience! The service was first class and the food was amazing. Combined with a great atmosphere and our lunch was truly memorable. I could not recommend it more highly, you NEED to eat here!
Great food and service as always.

Rigatoni with Sunday pork gravy - unbelievable! The vodka sauce is amazing too. Meatballs are tender, delicious and you can taste the veal! Ask for Julie - best server ever! She is the par excellence of serving: expressive, ebullient, and an expert in our needs!! I've never enjoyed a server more who can juggle multiple tables and make us all happy.
Very good Italian restaurant.
Sorry but okay at best

Would really give this 3.8 stars.  Went for lunch,  and service is very good. Food is good, but just not as good as some other places.  There was no chicken parmesan on the menu for lunch. The pastas are said to be all handmade fresh. Got the ravioli stuffed with parmesan and beans, it was pretty good.
The food was very tasty. The service was professional. I will go back there again
Dynamite traditional Italian provided in a classic setting and with excellent service!
I used to LOOOVE this place.  But dont go late on a Saturday, it gets way too loud and they cater more towards large parties than individual tables.
Food: ★★★★★ Service: ★★★★★
First time visit, good food, great wait staff, l well be back
Good food super service,food could of been a bit hotter
Had the 52 oz steak... had to share it 2 others... I should of not ordered to much appetizers. I also like their risotto...

Absolutely fantastic. Really friendly staff, and superb food. The pasta is fantastic and the seafood items were flavorful. They were kind enough to make me something off me u, one of my favorites from my trips to Italy; Spaghetti all'Arrabbiata with Italian sausage.

Seemed like a well known old school Italian joint from the neighborhood but I honestly thought it was just ok. Mom asked for a penne vodka which they agreed to but what came out was definitely not vodka sauce. I got the bucatini with zucchini which was just ok and really heavy with oil.
Great Italian food in the Bronx

Incredible food with a friendly staff. This is a traditional Italian restaurant and it's clear from the moment you walk in. Whether you sit at the bar to have an espresso or sit down at a table for lunch/dinner, the experience is relaxing in every way. Sit back, relax, and enjoy this memorable Italian gem.
Wonderful experience. Shout out to our waiter, Vinny! The nicest waiter and very helpful with all his suggestions. Best dinner ever
Great atmosphere, very good wait staff, quality food, enjoyed our time. Avoid downstairs seating if possible.
Great food

Fantastic food. Great service. Good wine list. For me it was perfect.

A hidden treasure. Have been here countless times and it is always consistently impressive. Expansive wine list, helpful wait staff, extensive specials every night. Good for a date night. Make a reservation!
The best Negroni. Seriously!

I was expecting to be amazed with all great reviews for this place, but it was just above okay. Not bad but definitely not great.

Food over all just OK. The seafood Fusilli was fresh and good. Bread was stale, dessert I ordered was special of that day, it was pre-prepared, not fresh at all. People at the restaurant some were cordial some were pretty rude. Overall it was just poor to OK for the price.

Consistently excellent service, reasonable prices and as good as Italian food gets outside of Italy. We've been eating at Roberto's for 16 years and it has never disappointed us.

Is a kind of expensive restaurant , but is all worthy . I ordered an octopus that was delicious. My boyfriend ordered pasta, he loves pasta. The atmosphere is very cozy and relaxed. We would definitely go back

Great food ! I loved it just like back in Italy , oh and one waiter named al i believe was the best one there always asking if everything's ok and ohh let me tell you about this little presentation when he unwrapped our main course 😩 loved it 👍🏻 you can tell he had been doing that job for a while he was a pro. I would make him manager if i owed that place.

My boyfriend and i have been going there a couple of times and always had a great experience, but today was a horrible experience. When i got there before my partner I had to wait in the front standing. I've went to other restaurants and this never happened before. When we was about to be seated they ask if they can take our coats when i say I'm fine the hostess tells me she has  to ask  her manager if that's fine, when i get seated everyone there has a jacket on their chair so why they asked us to leave our coat in the front ?? At the end when i ask for the dessert the waitress takes more than 10 minutes to check on me so I decided to just ask for the bill do not recommend this place.
Delicious!
Quant (10 or 12 tables) Italian restaurant, off the beaten path of Arthur Ave. Food was excellent and service was not lacking.  Great wine selection. Moderately priced and well worth it!
Simply excellent. Make sure to make a reservation.
Hyped up spot! Way too expensive for the type of cuisine they offer.
Great just great. Good food. Excellent service. Old school in da  Bronx.
Do you remember when Anton Ego has a flashback to his childhood from a bite of food in Ratatouille?  I had that with some foil-cooked Radiatorri at Roberto's.  Insanely good.
Wonderful authentic southern italian food
Best Italian restaurant
The best waiter ever, Vinnie
Black truffle fettuccine is a must!

We live on Long Island and meet our friends from Connecticut,  almost monthly, at Roberto's. The food is consistently excellent, the staff is friendly and the service is outstanding. Looking forward to our next visit.
Made a reservation but had to wait almost 40 minutes for our table. Aside from that terrible experience, the food and service were phenomenal! Be sure to try the pasta baked in foil!
Not what I expected.. had the lamb osso buco was so salty had to send it back.

Went here for sort of a celebration dinner, and had such a wonderful experience, the food and drinks were great. The staff was a little curt, when it came to answering questions, but I could easliy attribute that to the cultural difference, as many of the servers seemed to be european, and it had perhaps been a long night (it was ABSOLUTELY PACKED when we arrived). Great place, wonderful food, and be sure to check out the specials!
I had the double cut pork chop with parmesan potatoes.  Pork chop was very tender however potatoes were lacking.
Great place to have a meal!

(Translated by Google) Simply exquisite !! Select and relaxing atmosphere accompanied by exceptional food and first-class service !!  (Original) Simplemente exquisito!! Selecto y relajante ambiente acompañado de una excepcional comida y una atención de primera!!

Excellent fettuccini with shave truffles.  Came late after ball game, seated right away with great service.  All the food was excellent including desserts which are homemade.  Would definitely return.

we went here this past wknd for a birthday dinner with a total of 6 ppl. The bill was over $400, and about 6 mins after we paid the bill, the waiter asked us if we could leave bc they had ppl waiting.   How convenient that he waited for his tip to be allocated before making the VERY RUDE request.  There are way too many dining choices in this area for me to ever have to go here again and I will not.
One of my favorite places to eat in Little Italy. Must go to if you go to Arthur Ave
DELICIOUS!!
Good product, pasta al dente but overpriced
One of my all-time favorite restaurants in all of NYC. Hands down some of the best pasta in the city and great food all around.
Excellent food. Small place with wait-staff scurrying. Very good service. Fantastic cocktails. Very crowded on a Saturday night so make reservation.
it's unbeatable

I always had a hunch about Roberto's.  Having welding in my background, I always admired the wrought iron gates that compliment Roberto's exterior. I figured, if a business owner is forward thinking enough to distinguish their business with high quality  gate work, there must be something worth while inside, and there is!  For couples, finding seating is easier, groups should call ahead. Birthdays are big here, 3 on our first visit alone... The food was excellent, I had fish, my Fiance had pork chops, and it was amazing! The Malbec was sweet and smiley.  Roberto's is a gem, and now counted amoung our favorites!!
One of the best restaurants in the city!
Really good Italian food just off Arthur avenue.
Consistently very good.
A great restaurant experience.

Best restaurant in Little Italy.  If you want red sauce staples, this is not the place.  If you want modern Italian cuisine, excellent fresh made pasta, with a great wine selection. ..This is where you go!
Amazing Italian food in a cozy atmosphere
Good food,  great service.  The bronzini was the best I've had in this country
Food, homemade pasta. Great service.
Excellent Restaurant!
Great food and wine!  Check out the wine cellar downstairs
Very good Italian spot right off Arthur Ave. Fresh pasta is always great
My favorite italian restaurant. Every thing on the menu is beyond delicious and not to mention this is the best service I have ever received at a restaurant. They are truly phenomenal.
Love love the food here, the customer service is excellent 😊😊😊😊😊
Best rabbit I ever had
The best restaurant in Arthur ave
Unbelievably good!
Excellent food Great service!! Definitely will come back Parking the only issue
Seriously, the best Italian food I've ever had. You need a reservation for a good reason: it's the best Italian restaurant in the Arthur Ave area.
Great service, food, and atmosphere. We are definately coming back.
Nice old world feel with delicious options
Extensive wine list, Italian servers, authentic pasta.
Great authentic Italian food and the service was top notch as well.
Ummmmm!!! Who ever is the chef,  Bravo!
Had a real authentic feel to it.
Nice place

Definitely NOT your Italian-American red-sauce joint. Roberto's really reminded me of eating out in Italy (except the bread was better! Not sure why but never liked the bread served in Italy - esp Tuscany). I have eaten at Roberto's a few times, always impressed but I was moved to write this by a pasta special - Smoked duck with red and gold beets - brought out in foil and opened at the table - the pasta was obviously hand made and had a totally different texture than regular noodles. A real treat. The place is small so be careful about just showing up a busy times. Service was excellent and not snooty at all.
The best restaurant in the area. So good Brian Cashman of the New York Yankees was having dinner there while we were.
(Translated by Google) The best Ytalian food  (Original) La mejor comida ytaliana
always great

Robertos is an Italian restaurant for semi-formal dinners. There is a mandatory coat check before you enter, be sure to take off your coat and grab a ticket. The eggplant parmesan app was really good. The chef walked around and made sure everyone enjoyed their food, which was nice. They serve wine. If you want beer, they have three types of bottled beer. It's a bit pricey.
Great food.

I am a native New Yorker and will keep to the directness of how we are known to be :)  Food: Very good authentic classical Italian experience. I really enjoyed their cavatelli and sausage. Drinks: Great wine list! Space: The bar is sleek and modern and the dining room is very intimate and spacious. It's a very elegant atmosphere making it great for date nights and get-togethers. Scene: Date night. Romantic dinner. People watching. Single Scene. Crowd: 30-60s Mostly locals, professionals, and families. Service: Very attentive, courteous and professional!

Roberto's is a higher end Italian Ristorante, a place to go to on special occasions when you are looking for dishes that are more inventive and seasonally influenced than your standard Italian menu. The pasta portions are large; great for sharing with the table, and the ingredients are fresh and deliciously prepared. Roberto's servers are attentive, professional, and more than happy to give advice on which items to order. So why only an average rating? The Little Italy of the Bronx is filled with places to eat and there are other amazing options that cost a fraction of Roberto's prices. I may go back to Roberto's if I want to expand my Italian dish horizons, but for the true Arthur Ave experience, I'll stick to eating in the market or at one of the delis.
The very best Italian food in the Bronx and probably the city.  Chef-owned and carefully managed.  Everything about this place is wonderful and a treat.  Be prepared to spend a penny.
Possibly the best pasta I have ever had!!!
"Da Best"
More sophistication than most in Arthur Avenue area, but food is not quite as good.
Pricey for the area, not well lit Otherwise the food is very good
Worth the trip & the wait - this place is the real deal!

The hostess was soooooooooooo rude and obnoxious, if we werent meeting other people I would have walked out or punched her if she was a guy. I've been to other restaurants on Arthur Ave...some better some not but these people treat you like they are doing you a favor...I had to ask the waiter 3 times for my drink....the food was good,not spectacular, needless to say I'll spend my money elsewhere.

Not worth the trip .. Theres many other restaurant in the Bronx that blow Robertos away. Its not innovative in the least bit. They host a nice selections of wine but I do believe Patricia's on Morris Park has a larger selection .. Overall not a great expeirence!
worth the wait, hurry over to sample Roberto Paciullo's fine cuisine, as good as any in the city and at a reasonable price; let the waiter guide you and you won't be disappointed
At times brilliant, otherwise great.
The eclectic menu was sure to include at least one item per dish that I don't like. Warning to families: there is no kids' menu, though the ambient noise is enough to cover up your children's voices.
Spectacular dishes, above the usual Arthur Avenue fare.  Allow Roberto or one of his staff guide you through the extensive menu.  Go oof hours or be prepared to wait.
real italian   fine food

everything we tried was great. we only go for lunch which means you don't normally have to wait. only a few tables in the place means that you get the attention you deserve from the wait staff. we allowed them to order us the antipasto for starters. we then each ordered from the specials, as there is not really a set menu, so you know everything is fresh.  what it comes down to is you are in the arthur avenue area you should try roberto's you will not be disappointed.
roberto walks around to personally inspect his meals, all of which were excellent. the homemade pastas were supreme, and the main courses were great as well. huge portions. great wine list.
food was very tasty and unusual. the trip is worth the food adventure.
used to be good before it gained celebrity status
